item.title: MicrosoftFabricMgmt: Getting Started - Installation and Authentication
item.description:
Introduction

Yesterday I introduced the MicrosoftFabricMgmt module and explained what it can do. Today we are getting hands on â€” installing the module, sorting out dependencies, and making your first connection to Microsoft Fabric.

By the end of this post you will have the module installed, be authenticated, and have your first list of Fabric workspaces in your terminal.

Prerequisites

MicrosoftFabricMgmt requires PowerShell 7 or later. It will not work on Windows PowerShell 5.1. If you are still on 5.1, now is a great time to upgrade. You can download PowerShell 7 from here.
